item.title: The Hasso Plattner Institute is offering a free six-week MOOC on the Internet
item.description:
The Hasso Plattner Institute (HPI) is offering a free, six-week online course in English about the fundamentals of the Internet. Starting on March 31st, HPI’s director, Professor Christoph Meinel, will teach participants about the technical basis of the Internet through a massive open online course (MOOC) titled “Introduction to Internetworking with TCP/IP.” The course is available to anyone and can be accessed through free registration. Professor Meinel believes that anyone who uses the Internet for daily tasks like online shopping, reading news articles, or sending emails should understand the technologies that make these actions possible...

item.title: Internet Soothes The Savage Beasts
item.description:

Surprisingly, once installed, disruptive behavior vanished, and students became more engaged in their homework. This success story highlights a key point: providing Internet access can effectively address disciplinary issues. item.title: Cognizant: Training programs are not keeping up with evolving realities
item.description:
Businesses and higher education institutions (HEIs) need to prepare workers for jobs that don’t even exist yet, according to a new report by Cognizant. The Future of Learning report, based on a survey of business executives and HEI leaders, found that while both groups recognize the need to prepare students for a workplace transformed by digital technologies, they are struggling to adapt. Although the majority of businesses (80%) and HEIs (72%) understand the importance of equipping workers with the skills needed for this new environment, there is a gap between awareness and action...
